meanings.definition: Of or relating to the normal functions of a living organism.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the physiologic changes in the body were completely normal.
meanings.sent2: It is important to maintain a physiologic balance for overall health.
meanings.sent3: The physiologic dance of the cells kept the body in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a physiologic tonic, spreading joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The physiologic rhythm of the heart beat echoed through the room.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of or appropriate to an organism's healthy or normal functioning.
meanings.sent1: Eating fresh fruits and vegetables is physiologic for a balanced diet.
meanings.sent2: The physiologic response to exercise is increased heart rate and sweating.
meanings.sent3: The physiologic glow of her skin showed she was truly happy.
meanings.sent4: His words had a physiologic effect on her, calming her nerves instantly.
meanings.sent5: The physiologic strength of the athlete was evident in every move.
